column1: Narrator : CAPITAINE stumbles into a whale sized cove, with no particular things to notice…
column2: Narrator : The crew happens upon an islet, smaller than NOMBATEAU, with nothing on it…
column3: Narrator : CAPITAINE tumbles into very humble beach of reef. Nothing there is worthy of time…
column4: Narrator : CAPITAINE stubs toe into a narrow, trivial atoll. Nothing would strike anybody’s interest here…
column5: Narrator : CAPITAINE comes up against a undersized cay. Nothing there is worthy of notice…
Narrator : ...with the exception of a parrot… Holding a shiny item in his claws…
column9: Narrator : … with the exception of a teeny squirrel, nibbling a shiny object in his paws.
column13: Narrator : … with the exception of a very deep pond at CAPITAINE ‘s feet. A shiny objects lingers at the bottom of it.
column16: Narrator : … with the exception of a huge tree, at the top of which hangs a shiny, unrecognizable item…

column5: Choice : (see the rest of the island)
column6: Choice : I need this more than you, feathered beast ! (cha)
column8: Choice : Hand me the thing, bird…
column9: Choice : (see the rest of the island)
column12: Choice : Hand me the thing, nibbler…
column13: Choice : (see the rest of the island)
column16: Choice : (see the rest of the island)

column12: Narrator : The squirrel stares at THROWER with empty eyes.

column6: Narrator : The bird screams nonsence and flies away, leaving the shiny item on the floor
column7: Narrator : The bird insults you repeatedly before flying off, and droppping the item in the ocean, out of reach
column8: Narrator : The bird insults you repeatedly before flying off, and droppping the item in the ocean, out of reach
column10: Narrator : THROWER launches in the air, quick as an eagle, and catches the squirrel.
column11: Narrator : THROWER launches into the air, but the squirrel dodges and fades in the sand
column14: Narrator : THROWER beautifully plunges at the bottom, and emerges with the objects in his hands, barely out of breath
column15: Narrator : THROWER dives and ermeges back at the surface, out of breath and panicked !
column17: Narrator : With a swift, powerful blow, THROWER strikes the tree so hard, a crack echoes on the islet. The item gently falls behind the tree, while CAPITAINE picks it up.
column18: Narrator : THROWER lays a weak, uninspired blow to the tree, sadly moaning as he hurts his arm.

column10: Narrator : The creature drops the object, before disappearing under a rock.

column2: Narrator : The captain wakes on the islet. The morning air is pure and fresh.

column1: Narrator : A few bushes have grown here and there.

column3: Choice : Let’s look around for some food (loot)

column2: Narrator : The boat is on an islet. The morning air is pure and fresh.
column4: PlayerSpeak : Nothing to eat around here...

column1: Narrator : NOMBATEAU sets anchor near a tiny island.
Narrator : A tall rock stands in the middle of it.

column2: Narrator : The boat is on an islet. The morning air is pure and fresh.
column4: Narrator : The rock is too tall for CAPITAINE to just go up, they’ll need to climb.

column6: Narrator : As they're climbing, one of the holds crumbles under CAPITAINE's foot and they fall backwards!

column1: PlayerSpeak : The view is incredibly beautiful from up here.

column4: PlayerSpeak : I don’t have any spyglass...

column3: PlayerSpeak : We can see much better!
